column10:
1) Team has been sent to spy on some rebels in a logging village.
2) During the mission, Hayato's and Aiko's egos clash heavily.
3) Yuki tries to make peace between the two, but is ignored by both.
4) It's unveiled that general Okkoto is in the village. They must learn his plans.
5) They learn that the rebels will attack Kanazawa, where Yuki was born.
6) At the end, Hayato and Aiko send Yuki with the news to Brogun. The two will follow general Okkoto so maybe they can learn more.
The team discusses how they will find out the rebel plans. Hayato and Aiko have different professional opinions and can't agree on anything.
EN
column12: Simplified Chinese

column10: Hida Village
column12: 飞騨村

column10: This must be Hida village. I say we stick to the shadows. Avoid the lights.
column12: 这里就是飞騨村了。注意避开火光，暗中行动。

column10: I approve of your words, Hayato-san, but it will require more to learn the rebels' plans.
column12: 隼人兄所言极是。不过，要查清叛军的计划，还得先收集点情报。

column10: The villagers are being treated poorly. I do not think they would expose us, even if we show ourselves to them.
column12: 村民都受尽了虐待。所以就算被他们看到，应该也不会给叛军通风报信的吧。

column10: The tavern will be full of conversation. No doubt we will gain insight there.
column12: 酒馆那儿聊得正酣。打探一番必有收获。

column10: Too crowded for my taste. Why not go for the stables? Less people, more cover.
column12: 那边人多眼杂。还是去牛棚吧？人又少，还便于藏身。

column10: The tavern is the safer option. All we need is a suitable disguise.
column12: 还是酒馆更安全。只要有件合适的伪装即可。

column10: Heh, admit it, you just want a new set of clothes.
column12: …嗯，你就是想穿新衣服而已吧。

column10: Uhm … can we just decide on the way?
column12: 嗯……要不等会儿再决定吧？

column10:
This is the first night vision in the game. Enemy field of view works differently.
(trigger on tutorial scroll pickup)
column12: This is the first night vision in the game. Enemy field of view works differently.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Ah, always a pleasure working at night.
column12: 哼，还是夜里行动最好。

column10: It has it's advantages.
column12: 确实有好处。

column10: Keep your head down, avoid the lights, and no one will be able to spot us.
column12: 蹲下走，远离光源，这样就没人能发现我们。

column10: One of the team members extinguishes a lamp to hide in the shadows.
column12: One of the team members extinguishes a lamp to hide in the shadows.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Fire's dead. Someone's bound to notice.
column12: 肯定会有人注意到火灭了。

column10: Lights out! Leave before the guard sees it!
column12: 火灭了！在守卫发现前赶紧离开！

column10: These new shadows will not go unnoticed.
column12: 巡逻的敌人肯定会发现这边变暗了。

column10: A rebel orders a villager to burn their belongings.
column12: A rebel orders a villager to burn their belongings.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Bring more!
column12: 再添把柴！

column10: We'll burn everything!
column12: 全都给我烧了！

column10: We can't let the fire go out.
column12: 火不能灭。

column10: Hurry. It's getting cold.
column12: 快点。火都快熄了。

column10: Faster, you dirty peasant.
column12: 麻利点，这帮贱民。

column10: That can't be all, can it?
column12: 怎么可能就这么点儿？

column10: Yuki is disturbed by the rebels abuse of the villagers.
column12: Yuki is disturbed by the rebels abuse of the villagers.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Why do the rebels hate the villagers so?
column12: 为什么叛军这么恨村民？

column10: I don't think they hate them.
column12: 我看他们并不是恨村民。

column10: So they just like hurting them.
column12: 那他们只是很喜欢欺负人吗？

column10: They do this to spread fear, child. The villagers take this abuse, for if they resist, they will no doubt be executed.
column12: 他们这么做只是为了制造恐慌，村民们也只能默默承受。因为一旦反抗，会被当场处决。

column10: Oh …
Aiko and Hayato argue whether or not they should swim through the lake. (ARGUMENT)
column12: Aiko and Hayato argue whether or not they should swim through the lake. (ARGUMENT)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Swimming across will get us close to the tavern.
column12: 从这里游过去就是酒馆了。

column10: Don't think we should go that way.
column12: 我还是觉得走这边不好。

column10: Hayato-san! Don't tell me you can't swim!
column12: 隼人兄！该不是你不会游泳吧？

column10: You can't be serious …
column12: 开什么玩笑……

column10: Aiko and Hayato argue whether or not they should take the road through the outer village. (ARGUMENT)
column12: Aiko and Hayato argue whether or not they should take the road through the outer village. (ARGUMENT)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Let's follow the road, it'll take us to the stables.
column12: 沿着这条路，就能走到牛棚。

column10: I am against taking this route.
column12: 我反对走这边。

column10: What? Afraid you'll ruin your feet?
column12: 为什么？路太远你走不动？

column10: Yes, that would be awful. You would have to carry me.
column12: 是啊，我脚吃不消。只能靠你背我了。

column10: I … what?
column12: 呃…饶了我吧！

column10: The team discovers a disguise near the generals tent. (ARGUMENT)
column12: The team discovers a disguise near the generals tent. (ARGUMENT)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: I see clothing lines. This looks promising.
column12: 我看见晾衣绳了。似乎有不错的衣服。

column10: Took you long enough to get there. I hope you're satisfied.
column12: 费这么大劲陪你找到这里。这下你满意了？

column10: Immensely. Your disapproval makes it even more delightful.
column12: 非常满意。而且看你这么不爽我就更开心了。

column10: Hrm …
Aiko puts on ther disguise. (ARGUMENT)
column12: Aiko puts on ther disguise. (ARGUMENT)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Now, this is much better.
column12: 这下像点样子了。

column10: Want me to fetch you a bath too?
column12: 要不我再帮您扛个澡盆过来？

column10: Thank you, that would be wonderful.
column12: 那可就再好不过了。

column10: You never yield, do you?
column12: 你还真是嘴上不饶人啊？

column10: A rebel guards two terrified village women.
column12: A rebel guards two terrified village women.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Almost time.
column12: 差不多到时间了。

column10: Please. Let us go!
column12: 求求你，放我们走吧！

column10: Quiet now.
column12: 闭嘴。

column10: The team saves the two terrified village women.
column12: The team saves the two terrified village women.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: T-thank you. Thank you so much!
column12: 谢-谢谢你们。感激不尽！

column10:
Yuki is disturbed by the rebels abuse of the villagers.
(Happens only if you save the woman.)
column12: Yuki is disturbed by the rebels abuse of the villagers.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Those men … they were going to …
column12: 那些人…他们居然想…

column10: I know, child. I know …
column12: 我明白你的感受……

column10: I hate them!
column12: 我恨他们！

column10: We did what we could. Let's move on.
column12: 我们已经尽力了，继续任务吧。

column10: The team discoveres a pair of talking officers in the outer village. (ARGUMENT)
column12: The team discoveres a pair of talking officers in the outer village. (ARGUMENT)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: So, we are at the stables.
column12: 好吧，还是到牛棚来了。

column10: See the two samurai? I bet they have something interesting to say.
column12: 看到那两个武士没？他们肯定在聊些有用的情报。

column10: And now must dash after them like fools.
column12: 所以我们要像白痴一样，踉踉跄跄地跟在他们后面偷听么。

column10: I will do my best to avoid them. A problem not present at the tavern.
column12: 我会尽量避开他们的视线。要是去酒馆那边，根本就用不着这么麻烦。

column10: Rebels are drinking heavily at the tavern and terrorize the servants.
column12: Rebels are drinking heavily at the tavern and terrorize the servants.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Hey! What's taking so long? More sake!
column12: 喂！在磨蹭什么？赶紧添酒！

column10: Forgive me. We had to fetch another barrel.
column12: 请大人息怒。酒喝光了，正去拿新的。

column10: Forgive me. We had to fetch another barrel.
column12: 请大人息怒。酒喝光了，正去拿新的。

column10: Do I look like I care? When we call, you come running, understand?!
column12: 少废话！让你上酒，就赶紧过来，明白了吗？

column10: Yes. Of course.
column12: 遵，遵命。

column10: Yes. Of course, my lord.
column12: 遵，遵命，大人。

column10: Rebels are drinking heavily at the tavern and terrorize the servants. (random)
column12: Rebels are drinking heavily at the tavern and terrorize the servants. (random)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: More sake!
column12: 添酒！

column10: Mmmm, haha!
column12: 唔嗯，哈哈！

column10: To General Okkoto!
column12: 敬乙事大将！

column10: Ahh.
column12: 啊啊。

column10: Faster, peasant!
column12: 动作快点，贱民！

column10: Forgive me.
column12: 万分抱歉。

column10: Yes. Of course.
column12: 是，遵命。

column10: At once.
column12: 马上就来。

column10: Anything for you. Of course, my lord.
column12: 是，任您吩咐，大人。

column10: Yuki is disturbed by the rebels abuse of the villagers.
column12: Yuki is disturbed by the rebels abuse of the villagers.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Will they leave the women alone?
column12: 他们会放过那些女人吗？

column10: I wish I could say yes. But I don't think the sake will help with that.
column12: 我很想说“会”。但那些人都喝醉了，所以……

column10: I don't like these people.
column12: 我讨厌这些人。

column10: A sentiment that we all share.
column12: 此刻大家心情都一样。

column10: The team discoveres a pair of talking officers at the tavern. (ARGUMENT)
column12: The team discoveres a pair of talking officers at the tavern. (ARGUMENT)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Don't think there's enough cover here. Let's head for the stables.
column12: 这里能藏身的地方太少。还是去牛棚吧。

column10: The two officers seem talkative. They would not notice if I'd followed them in disguise.
column12: 那两个军官好像聊得正欢。如果我乔装后靠近偷听，应该不会被发现。

column10: Fact is: we don't have one. And we wouldn't need one if we were at the stables.
column12: 你这不是没去找衣服就直接过来了么。如果去牛棚，根本就不需要什么伪装。

column10: Fine. You already have your new clothes. Might as well use them.
column12: 好吧。既然都已经拿到新装了，不妨穿上试试。

column10: Yuki is concerned because her teammates are constantly bickering. (happens after 2 ARGUMENTs)
column12: Yuki is concerned because her teammates are constantly bickering. (happens after 2 ARGUMENTs)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Uhm … why are you fighting?
column12: 呃……你们为什么吵架啊？

column10: Not now, Yuki …
column12: 不是问这种问题的时候，友希…

column10: Yuki tries to make peace between her team mates. (happens after 4 ARGUMENTs or after GENERAL)
column12: Yuki tries to make peace between her team mates. (happens after 4 ARGUMENTs or after GENERAL)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Hayato-sensei … why can't you agree with Aiko-san?
column12: 隼人师父……你为什么总是和爱子姐闹别扭？

column10: Maybe it's because I'm a bad sensei. Why don't you go find a new one?
column12: 因为我本来就不是什么好师父。你赶紧另寻高明吧？

column10: Hayato-san …
column12: 隼人师父……

column9: knows he hurt Yuki a bit, with a sigh
column10: Sorry. Things are too tense here. Let's talk later, alright?
column12: 抱歉。是我话说重了。我们稍后再聊，好吗？

column10: The team regroups and discusses what they have heard.
column12: The team regroups and discusses what they have heard.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Interesting.
column12: 有意思。

column10: Did you hear that?!
column12: 你听到了吗？！

column10: This information is vital! Let us find a safe spot and discuss what we've learned.
column12: 这个情报很关键！找个安全的地方整理一下吧。

column10: The team has gathered information from listening in on some officers.
column12: The team has gathered information from listening in on some officers.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Are we all here?
column12: 全员都到了吧？

column10: Here!
column12: 到了！

column10: Easy, Yuki.
column12: 别激动，友希。

column10: It appears general Okkoto is here himself. He is having a word with the village elder.
column12: 看来乙事大将本人也在村里。正在和村长谈话。

column10: Let's listen in. He'll tell us his plans!
column12: 我们去偷听吧。说不定会听到他的计划呢！

column10: I agree. Let us seize this opportunity. If we can get close, and with a disguise …
column12: 同意。要抓住这次机会。如果我能乔装接近的话……

column10: How's this: you use your disguise, I stick to the shadows. Let's see who gets the mark.
column12: 要不这样吧，你用伪装，我用潜行。看谁先得手。

column10: Let us focus on the task at hand, Hayato-san. We can play your childish games when our mission is done.
column12: 请以眼前任务为主，隼人兄。任务完成后，我再陪你玩过家家。

column10: The team comes close to Okkoto at the town elder's house.
column12: The team comes close to Okkoto at the town elder's house.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: The general … he's a bad man.
column12: 那就是大将……坏人。

column10: General Okkoto. A vicious man.
column12: 乙事大将，此人心狠手辣。

column10: Okkoto, huh … imagine if we killed him. That'd end the rebellion pretty quickly.
column12: 乙事，哈……你说要是我们把他杀了，叛乱不就能很快结束了么。

column10: You would only end yourself! Do not attack him!
column12: 去了就是送死！千万不要对他出手！

column10: You don't really think I'm that stupid, do you?
column12: 你当真觉得我有那么蠢么？

column10: Okkoto is giving orders to his officers.
column12: Okkoto is giving orders to his officers.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: We will march at the break of dawn.
column12: 天一亮就进军。

column10: The men have another hour to enjoy themselves.
column12: 就让他们再快活半个时辰吧。

column10: I do not care for these filthy peasants.
column12: 这帮贱民会怎么样不关我的事。

column10: Make sure the carts are loaded and secured.
column12: 货物要全部装上马车，派人看好。

column10: We will win glory and honour for Kage-sama.
column12: 要为影大人的荣耀而战。

column10: We have long waited for a good battle.
column12: 这一战酝酿已久。

column10: Any peasant who fails to obey will be executed.
column12: 如有贱民胆敢不从，格杀勿论。

column10: The team comes close to Okkoto at the town elder's house.
column12: The team comes close to Okkoto at the town elder's house.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: We will take all the rice from your granaries, and also your oxen. See that it is done.
column12: 把你们粮仓里的米都搬出来，还有牛也交出来。快去办。

column10: … these peasants … they will not survive the year.
column12: ……那这些农民……都活不下去了。

column10: If they wanted to eat they should have joined our cause. The mighty Kage-sama has ordered that we take the city of Kanazawa tomorrow. I want the men well fed.
column12: 要想活命，就早该投靠我们。影大人下令，明天就要攻打金泽市。所以要让士兵们先吃饱才行。

column10: I will instruct the officers to give out extra rations.
column12: 我一会去通知各个军官，多发些口粮。

column10: Kanazawa castle will be our bulwark against the wrath of the Shogun. Once it is ours, we will hold it until Kage-sama arrives with his army.
column12: 金泽城将是我们抵御将军进攻的坚实堡垒。一定要拿下它，然后坚守等影大人带援军过来。

column10: The team has heard all they need and plan to leave.
column12: The team has heard all they need and plan to leave.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Now we know Okkoto's and Kage-sama's plans.
column12: 这下乙事和影大人的计划就都知道了。

column10: … huh … Kanazawa city …
This must reach Noboru-sama as soon as possible. Let us steal a raft, head downriver and make for Noboru's camp.
column12: 这个情报一定要尽快告知昇大人。就去偷个木筏，沿河而下回昇大人的营地吧。

column10: For once I agree. Let's head to the piers.
column12: 这次我同意。快去码头吧。

column10: Finally!
column12: 你们终于不吵架啦！

column10: Aiko wants to stay and follow general Okkoto. Hayato wants to stay himself. Yuki convinces Aiko that she can deliver the news to Brogun so both can stay.
column12: Aiko wants to stay and follow general Okkoto. Hayato wants to stay himself. Yuki convinces Aiko that she can deliver the news to Brogun so both can stay.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Wait!
column12: 等一下！

column10: What now?
column12: 哎，又怎么了？

column10: It would be wise to follow the general and learn more about his plans. I will hide among his entourage as a concubine.
column12: 我应该尾随大将，打探更多情报才对。我可以假扮成小妾混到他的随从中。

column10: Good idea, but your plan's too risky. Take the raft, I'll follow them at a distance.
column12: 主意虽好，但太冒险了。你还是坐木筏走吧，让我去远远跟着他们就行。

column10: Will you hide atop the nearest mountain and read their lips from there?
column12: 然后呢，你要藏在最近的山顶上，用千里眼读他们的唇语不成？

column10: Why not both of you? Two's better than one.
column12: 为什么不两个人一起去呢？两个总比一个好。

column10: No, Yuki-chan. One of us must inform Lord Noboru.
column12: 不行，友希妹妹。我俩总得有个人回去禀报昇大人。

column10: Aiko-san, I can do it!
column12: 爱子姐，这事交给我吧！

column10: This is an urgent matter, too important to leave it in the hands of a child.
column12: 此事至关重要，怎么能交给一个孩子来办。

column10: I am not a child! I'll get there in time!
column12: 我不是小孩子了！我会按时赶到的！

column10: She's right. Let her go.
column12: 她能行的。让她去吧。

column10: … very well. But I must stress how important this message is. Do not fail me in this, child.
column12: ……好吧。但这份情报真的非常重要，绝不能失败。

column10: Hai, Aiko-san!
column12: 明白，爱子姐！

column10: Alright, let us begin.
column12: 那就开始行动吧。

column10: MISSION-WORDCOUNT EN:
